Target: OntoBuildableSpace is an ontology developed to describe the attributes of land plots and their buildable spaces.

Comment: Absolute Height defines Buildable Space volume in meters. Absolute Height may be derived from number of storeys linked to Storey Aggregate and each storey's Floor To Floor Height.
Average depth represent average plot depth resulting from averaging sample depths along the plot's front edges
Average width represent average plot width resulting from averaging sample widths along the plot's side edges.

Buildable Space is the maximum allowable space on a plot that can built up according to relevant planning regulations. Buildable spaces may be linked to a Zone, LandUse or a particular Programme if there exist specific regulations. For instance, a plot on which flat and condominium developments are allowed, will have two buildable spaces - one for condominium and one for flat as a product of unique planning regulation combinations.
A Floor To Floor Height defines the storey height, from current storey floor to the floor of the next storey.
Footprint defines a boundary within which a specific storey exist.
Allowed Footprint Area linked to a specific storey.
Allowed Gross Floor Area is a sum of all allowed Footprint Areas for a specific Buildable Space.
As defined in https://www.ura.gov.sg/-/media/Corporate/Planning/Master-Plan/MP19writtenstatement.pdf
Setback defines distances that any development needs to be setbacked from plot boundary.
Front Setback applies to plot's side that has the main entrance facing the road.
Rear Setback applies to plot side that is opposite of plot's front side.
Road Buffer refers to setbacks related to adjecent road category instead of plot sides. Plot may have more than one road buffer if it is adjacent to multiple road plots.
Side Setback apply to the plot's side that is not Front nor Rear.
PartyWall setback refers to Side setback whose buffer distance is required to be 0m.
Site area or plot area.
Site Coverage defines the ratio between Site Area And Buildable Space 1st Storeys footprint area.
Storey refers to the spaces that within Buildable Space that are at the same height and does not require vertical connections.
Storey aggregate defines Buildable Space volume in storeys. Each buildable space will have one storey aggregate, consisting of multiple storeys.
Building Edge is an uninterupted set of storeys starting from the groundfloor that share the same setback and form a uniform volume.

Domain: AbsoluteHeight UNION FloorToFloorHeight UNION GrossFloorArea UNION GrossPlotRatio UNION Setback UNION SiteCoverage UNION StoreyAggregate
